questions.title: What are you planning to learn?
questions.answer:
-Causes of chlamydia infection.
-Treatment (contraindications, adverse reactions or side effects)
-Antibiotic resistance.

questions.title: How are you planning to learn it?
questions.answer: Getting the information from NHS (Clinical knowledge summaries) and from CPPE e-learning

questions.title: Give an example of how this learning has benefited the people using your services
questions.answer: People benefit from Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs) tests.

questions.title: What are you planning to learn?
questions.answer:
-Use of Lithium.
-Counseling patients about healthy lifestyle behaviors.
-Any signs of lithium toxicity that needs referrall.
- Common side effects of lithium.
-Potencial drug interactions.
-Lithium's Mechanism of Action.

questions.title: How are you planning to learn it?
questions.answer: Getting that information from the BNF, NICE webside ( NICE guidance on management of bipolar disorders), NPSA webside and others.

questions.title: Give an example of how this learning has benefited the people using your services
questions.answer: I coud advise a woman on Lithium that came to the Pharmacy for some painkillers. So I recommended to avoid NSAIDs and advised her to drink plenty of water while doing exercise as dehydration can increase her blood lithium levels.

questions.title: What are you planning to learn?
questions.answer:
I am planning to learn the following:
What are they used for?
How do they work?
Red flags that need referral.
Common side effects.
Potential drug interactions.

questions.title: How are you planning to learn it?
Give an example of how this learning has benefited the people using your services
questions.answer:
A 65 years old patient who was prescribed Naproxen (also taking Aspirin daily) was at
risk of GI side effects from NSAIDs so I referred him for assessment on whether co-prescribing of gastroprotection was required.

questions.title: What are you planning to learn?
questions.answer:
I would like to learn the following:
Types of flu virus along with types of outbreaks and factors wich affect this.
Symptoms of flu, its transmission, incubation and epidemiology.
Types of flu vaccine available,methods of administration, contraindications and adverse reactions.
Indentify patient groups most at risk from the effects of flu.

questions.title: How are you planning to learn it?
Give an example of how this learning has benefited the people using your services
questions.answer: People benefits from getting the flu jab without booking an appointment with their GP which is very convenient as they donÂ´t need to wait long for it.

messages.text: Hello fellow reviewer, how are you ?
Great thanks. Looks like a really interesting CPD entry doesn't it ?
